Material used.Material Name: PINK1 knockout mouse-derived substantia nigra dopaminergic neurons
Material used.Description: Cultured substantia nigra dopaminergic neurons from PINK1 knockout mice were used for confocal microscopy and ROS measurement.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1-deficient neurons exhibited depolarized mitochondrial membrane potential (ΔΨm), increased mitochondrial fragmentation, and elevated ROS levels compared to wild-type controls.
PINK1-deficient neurons exhibited depolarized mitochondrial membrane potential (ΔΨm), increased mitochondrial fragmentation, and elevated ROS levels compared to wild-type controls.
PINK1-deficient neurons exhibited depolarized mitochondrial membrane potential (ΔΨm), increased mitochondrial fragmentation, and elevated ROS levels compared to wild-type controls.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 overexpression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal ΔΨm, intact mitochondrial morphology, and ROS levels comparable to wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Depolarized ΔΨm, fragmented mitochondria, and elevated ROS levels compared to wild-type controls.
